Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, but don't stain the towels!”
Reviews.Author: verylucrative
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable, entire hotel non smoking, "truck parking" easy when I was there, but not much business, which is why the $50 per night rate was in effect, I guess. They have you sign a seperate agreement that, if you stain the towels you will pay for them, at some ridiculous prices. Onsite restaurant closed when I was there, and not much within walking distance to eat but certainly doable, Jack in the Box, McDonalds, Starbucks, Subway, CVS, Gas station.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, DONT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: VA2012_12
Reviews.Content: â€¢ Sign at the front desk: charge for towels if makeup and other bodily fluids could not be removed during laundering â€¢ room reeked of old cigarettes and filth â€¢ Seating area missing small love seat, there was an arm chair â€¢ New room we were re-assigned to had a view of the roof with bloody gloves and garbage â€¢ Air conditioner dripped liquid the entire night and kept us awake â€¢ Bug bites either from floor or mattress â€¢ Bathroom door warped and kept jamming â€¢ Cleaning service never cleaned our room â€¢ Bar and restaurant were closed during our visit â€¢ Breakfast selection was quite meager and the on both mornings, the ladies attending the breakfast area were quite unpleasant as they unloaded the Wal-Mart brand, Great Value food items. â€¢ Disgusting hotel and we had a horrid stay

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location, tired around the edges”
Reviews.Author: chalouisduletz
Reviews.Content: I chose this property based upon TripAdvisor reviews and had my expectations adjusted accordingly for a budget experience at $50 per night. On the plus side, the hotel is conveniently located in a city in which car is king ("lonelier than a pedestrian in Dallas" should become a new expression). Staff are very helpful and friendly, for example, a room was not ready when I arrived early and I received a cellphone call just as soon as one was. The room was spacious and clean, the bed was comfortable, the free WiFi speedy, the included breakfast buffet a nice touch. On the minus side, there are signs of wear and tear everywhere. In room 114 the upholstery on the arms of the desk chair is frayed and torn. The plastic bathtub surround has a large, crudely repaired crack around the faucet, which is loose. The public hallway carpet has so many stains it's beginning to look like a leopard print. In sum, come with a "you-get-what-you-pay-for" state of mind and you'll be fine here. Interestingly, the Grand Hotel Dallas (ROFLMAO) just across LBJ Freeway looks just as nice for $40 a night.

Reviews.Title: “The Best for your Money”
Reviews.Author: Richard P
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice,the service was even better! They even give you real eggs in their free breakfast unlike the microwaved eggs at comfort Inn where I paid $25.00 more a night to get less.You won't go wrong here,its close to everything and you will leave remembering you'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad...”
Reviews.Author: Charles B
Reviews.Content: I was hoping for more than what I got. While the hotel is pretty nice looking from a distance and even though some aspects are quite nice; the overall feel is that of a re-branded lower scale hotel. I was disappointed with the professionalism of the front desk staff, despite their friendliness. If management/ownership took some extra time to form a solid front desk team they could really positively alter the overall appeal of this hotel. The carpets were filthy throughout the guest hallways. Every door was heavily marked by dirt and scuffs. There was a general unpleasant smell throughout the guest hallways. These small DETAILS can turn a mediocre property into a great property and would have improved my scoring of the property by at least two marks. In the end, the price is what sold me.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: decosp
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights mainly because i got a relly good deal on expedia. The room was clean and it was spacious with a queen bed, flat screen tv, a desk, sofa, chairs, a mini refrigerator, microwave and a kettle. Free Wi-Fi The hotel is just off a freeway but I didnt have any problems with noise. Near the hotel you got a some fast food places like Subway, McDonalds and Jack In the Box. If you dont have a car and you want to go downtown you need to take the 360 on Coit Road to Forest Lane Station and from there you get the metro to downtown (45 minutes plus in total). If youre there for shopping theres no Malls nearby and you would have to take a taxi or a long journey on buses/metro. Another thing to notice is that this hotel used to be called Clarion Inn Park Central so if you are using taxis or if you are booking Super Shuttle or Go Yellow to/from the airport you wont find Ramada Dallas North on their online system, you will have to select Clarion Inn Park Central ($19 one way)

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingmanIllinois
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for one night. Room was not as clean as it could have been. Bed was average. Our telephone and hair dryer did not work which we informed the clerk (but this was not a big deal for us, as we had cell phones and our own dryer). The room could use some updating, but I did not downgrade it for that as I realize that for the price they charged it was within expectations. The breakfast was decent with many choices of foods and price considered was good. We did inform the attendant that the milk at breakfast had gone bad and she promptly replaced it. We are also in the hospitality business and I realize that these are very challanging times for our businesses and I dont think most guests have a clue about what it takes to run a business like this. My only advice for the management would be to work a little more on the cleaning part of the rooms, other then that for the price they charge I would recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Service was amazing!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Agotcher
Reviews.Content: The guy at the front desk was really nice I think his name was David. Anyways I thought the breakfast had a nice big selection and was very alert that some of thier food may contain food allergies. Very very impressed! We were planning on staying at a comfort suites but we had an awful expierience in San Antonio a couple of days before. So glad that we stayed here!

Reviews.Title: “Needs Work”
Reviews.Author: WestValleyTraveler
Reviews.Content: This motel came as part of a package trip. The room was comfortable but the buffet was low quality with minimal choice of food and the food was served to you like they wanted to insure you did not ruin the bottom line. There is a lounge in the motel but it was not open after the first two days. Beds were comfortable at least...

Reviews.Title: “the Ramada Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Ae L
Reviews.Content: well.... the breakfast area is clean and organize so make feel welcome. They have alots of choice of food like the resturant.and staff have big smile welcome.

Reviews.Title: “So disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Komo1007
Reviews.Content: Where to begin..Arrived to this "pet friendly" hotel to be questioned about having my yorkie in tow..?? Staff member said, 'ok she can go ahead and stay'..?? Got to 1st room- AC not working, trash on floor, used rag in bathroom, soap open, blood on towel..!!! Complained to very friendly staff, moved our family- child and baby included, to another room.. Which had empty beer cans on balcony and dirty night stands and sticky floors:/ oh, the hallway floors were stained with black residue and hotel reaked of smoke:///

Reviews.Title: “wonderful room, very clean, great service”
Reviews.Author: l g
Reviews.Content: I have been very pleased with the rooms, have stayed more than once..I found Robin the Manager to be very helpful..as well as the other staff members. The room was very clean, and service was great..

Reviews.Title: “Got a good hotwire price but bad service!!”
Reviews.Author: YPguy
Reviews.Content: I booked three rooms through hotwire for my youth group that was doing some mission work in downtown Dallas. Pros; The rooms were extremely nice for the deal we got on hotwire. Cons: The service was terrible! They had us booked for 3 to a room but then tried to tell us it was illegal to have that many people in a king size room. They tried to charge us $10 per room per night when they knew the number booked from the very beginning. The manager okayed us getting the double beds without charge. Then after 2 mornings of getting breakfast the front desk guy tried to say that we couldn't get 3 continental breakfasts and that we would have to talk to the manager. Both issues they tried to blame on hotwire, saying that hotwire will tell you anything to get you booked and that we payed too low so they would be losing money to give us the free breakfast they clearly advertised on their website when they knew the number of guests from the time of booking. Later in the week we asked the front desk girl if we could eat our sandwiches in the lobby. She said it would be fine but if we used the tables too close to the restaurant then we needed to ask them. Even though we didn't use the wrong tables, the restaurant people began yelling at one of my students for having food. Since we thought we were infringing on the restaurant we moved to a side room. The same people came in there yelling at us saying that we didn't rent that room, we only rented a hotel room, and that they owned the hotel. They even threatened to call the cops when we were clearly trying to leave the room. When I told them we were sorry and that we didn't realize that we couldn't use that conference room but that they didn't need to be so rude, their only response was "yea, you are sorry". I've been to a lot of hotels all over the world and worked in the travel industry with students for the last 4 years. I have never been treated so poorly. Not to mention from the owners.

Reviews.Title: “New favorite place to stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Zal332
Reviews.Content: Recently took a trip back to Dallas driving from Austin. Stayed here overnight and was very pleased with the staff and the service the hotel provided. The rooms were clean and I had a very relaxing sleep. The Korean restaurant has some of the best Korean food I've ever had. In fact, when I'm in town, I'll come to the hotel just to eat lunch or dinner there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Rainleaf83
Reviews.Content: This place is affordable and very clean. I felt right at home immediately. There is a great staff with attentive customer service willing to go the extra mile to make your stay an enjoyable one! They have a great free breakfast, high speed internet, a fitness center and pool. I was able to get a good night's sleep, which is rare for me since I tend to not sleep well in different environments. The hotel is in a super convenient location downtown and not too far from the Galleria for some great shopping and good restaurants. My friends and I enjoyed our stay while in town for a wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accommodations and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: MrC777
Reviews.Content: Service with a Smile Room was everything expected and more (clean - clean - clean) The best motel environment we have had in years Dinning area beautiful We do NOT have any negative remarks concerning our stay We stayed a 2nd night in April 2011 - and still the same quality

Reviews.Title: “I Am An Important Businessman - But Sometimes I Am An Important Leisureman”
Reviews.Author: CashMarvelous
Reviews.Content: I am an important businessman. If there's one thing I take seriously, it's business. If there are two things I take seriously, it's business and hotel rooms. What does this have to do with the Ramada Park Central Hotel? Everything. Let's start with the room. Bed for sleep business? Check. Bathroom for body business? Check. There is even a business center for business business and a fitness center for fitness business. I eat food which is why I was glad that there was a free breakfast. The parking lot was smooth and covered in soft asphalt. Right smack in the middle of Dallas too, tough guy, what a comfortable location. This was a leisure trip. I had a leisurely stay. My wife and I did leisurely things. There's a pool if you like pools. I do not like pools.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms and free breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: sindy2289
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here during spring break so that we would be closer to Dallas and can go out and enjoy the nightlife. The hotel was very nice and the service was great. The rooms were cleaned everyday and we had fresh towels. Also, they offer a complimentary breakfast. Our hotel stay offered more than I expected for the low prices. Definitely a great value.

Reviews.Title: “I stopped here on my way up to St. Louis.”
Reviews.Author: Zanith77
Reviews.Content: It was a nice hotel. I felt comfortable and the service is pleasant. The free breakfast was nice and considering the cost I was pleasantly surprised overall.

HotelInfo.Name: Ramada Dallas North Hotel and Conference Center
